critique: The document focuses on international cooperation to prevent the spread of cholera, highlighting the role of the federal government in addressing public health crises. It doesn't directly address typical left-right ideological issues but implies a role for government intervention in health matters. There's no discussion of immigration in general, but the document does touch on border control in the context of disease prevention. The document expands executive power to send a delegate to the conference. The document also centralizes authority in Washington for health crisis. There is a focus on security regarding health. There is government intervention regarding health. There is no mention of social issues.
